Package net.keinr.util

Class Console

java.lang.Object
net.keinr.util.Console
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Console
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
For taking user (or developer) input while main program is running.
Can specify regex strings and functions that run when those regex strings match.
All capture groups are send to the event function.

A very simple example would be:


 Console console = new Console();
 console.addCommand("^I am (.+)$", e -> {
     System.out.println("Oh, so your name is " + e[1] + "?");
 });
 console.start();
If you don't know regex, I HIGHLY reccomend it. Long gone are the days of me banging my head against the table while trying to hardcode string parsers.
Since:
2019-10-7

    • add

      public void add​(java.lang.String condition, Console.CommandString command)
      Add a command with a condition that will be considered when the console reads user input
      Parameters:
      condition - A regex string that will be compared to user input.
      If it does, the below function will be executed
      command - An implementation of the CommandString interface, this holds the function
      that will be run if the above regex is matched.
      It is important to note that an array will be returned containing all capture groups.
      Can be used with lambdas, so for example:

      
 console.addCommand("^hello, I'm (.+)$", e -> {
     System.out.println("Hello to you to, "+e[1]);
 });

      Oh, also important to note: This function sets the command set
      automatically to zero. Command sets allow you to toggle between
      different sets of commands.
      So, for example, if a command is in set 1 and the current
      command set is set to 0, that command will not be used.

    • add

      public void add​(java.lang.String condition, Console.CommandString command, int... commandSet)
      Same as the default, except this one allows you to specify the command's matched command sets.
      Specify -1 to match all.
      Parameters:
      condition - regex condition
      command - An implementation of the CommandString interface. I encourage you to use a lambada.
      commandSet - command sets
